column5: Saw on Fish TV that they did a show on Lakair this year. Any one else see it. Not much just more bass fishing than anything else.Remembering the GOOD TIMES WE ALL HAD.

I watched it Kelvin. Since the place closed down a small group of us stay in a lodge just north of there every June now and then my wife and I go back up for a couple more weeks in August. We drive thru Lakair every year just for a look and the new owners have completely redone all the cabins and the restaurant. We went to the new restaurant last year for supper and the place is really nice. I too miss all the great times we used to have up there every year.
Great picture Norm do remember that Big Guy Almost knocked me in.Â  Need to get back up there for some great times with great friends.. get this covid thing over with PLEASE

looks like the campground is gone, which is unfortunate. sleeping under canvas or nylon never gets tiring (usually). was hoping to get up there this summer but we all know how this year is going. maybe next...

I watched it too, if I am not mistaken they weren't fishing the West Arm they were fishing north of the West Bay closer to Lavigne. First G2G I went to everyone here including my family and friends thought I was nuts. Your going where?, to do what?, with people you only know via the internet?Â ðŸ˜² Good times for sure, made numerous trips and always had a good time. My son asked me awhile back if we could go back, he still remembers Lew's wife treating him with a piece of pie.
Oh I got the same thing from the mrs,s. Then I brought her up and well,she had a good time.
Great times for sure.. too bad they removed the camp ground l was going to try and setup a trip there next year if we get rid of this covid thing...
Sure do miss those days. Â Made some long lasting friendships.
That was what 2003 ish Chris? I think I joined the year after and never missed a GTG after that. Good times indeed.
Sounds like a video game.... "OFN - The Gathering" Those were the days alright!

I didn't read all the posts so if this was suggested sorry. I use NADA.com. It is the Blue Book for used boats, from canoes to yaghts. Find your manufacturer, find the make, year and fill out the questionaire. It will give the average selling price in USD. It is very close to our prices in southern Ontario once converted to CDN funds. Of course things like location will vary prices. A boat in Florida is going to be less than a boat inÂ Nevada.
Would be GREAT to have another ONE
My 1st time,I thought it was hooterville boss. LMÂ  F AO
That feels like forever ago now - I don't even recognize myself in that pic! (I'm standing left of you lol)
